artist: Louis Henri Sullivan; Northwestern Terra Cotta Works (a.k.a. Norweta)
creditline: Gift of the Department of Environmental Affairs
description: spandrel, tympanum and decorative panels from the Scoville Building, Chicago
text: The ferns and leaves on these terra cotta panels are in high relief, sticking far out from the background, so their heavy shadows would make them visible from the top (fifth) floor of the Scoville Building in Chicago. These pieces were part of the organic decoration of stylized plants that Sullivan used to tie together two buildings, the original Dankmar Adler structure and a new, larger addition by Adler and Sullivan.
title: Lunette
